channel.title: Pentagon activates global missile defense during NK's missile launch
channel.description:
The Pentagon recently activated its global missile shield in anticipation of North Korea’s launch of a long-range missile, according to defense officials. The measures include stepped-up electronic monitoring, deployment of missile interceptor ships, and activation of radar networks to areas near the Korean peninsula and western Pacific. Three interceptor ships near Japan and the Philippines, as well as U.S.-based interceptors, are ready to shoot down the North Korean missile if space-, land-, and sea-based sensors determine its flight path is targeted at the United States or U.S. allies, said officials who spoke on condition of anonymity. The Obama administration will regard any launch by North Korea as a violation of U.N. Security Council resolutions regardless of whether the North Koreans claim the rocket test is for space launch purposes, the officials said. The technology and rocketry used for a space launch is nearly identical to that used with ballistic missiles that carry a warhead, they said. Also, because the payload or warhead of the test launch cannot be determined prior to launch, the Obama administration decided to activate the missile defense system. According to U.S. officials, current intelligence assessments indicate the North Korean missile will be launched from a base called Tongchang-ri, located on a west coast peninsula north of Pyongyang between April 12 and April 15.
http://freebeacon.com/red-alert/

item.title: Pentagon activates global missile defense during NK's missile launch
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“Radeon, post:15, topic:438287”]It needs to be shot down. Firstly they’re fucking insane, I wouldn’t trust what the NKs claim to be their intentions. Secondly let them stop this space program and feed their people instead.

How about we just make sure it doesn’t fly towards the United States and mind our own fucking business, our allies can take care of their-selves, if it turns out to have been something else then we can take appropriate action.

The North Koreans are idiots and aren’t going to bomb anyone because they know if they do they will get wiped off the face of the fucking earth

Do you have any idea what the fuck you’re talking about?
I’m not even going to bother with explaining why you’re so wrong.

Your fucking right, interventionism is the route we should go, because its been working so fucking great for us for the last 60 years just like when we overthrew Mohammad Mosaddegh in 1953 and then supplied Saddam Hussein with weapons in 1983, we just keep causing our own fucking problems, ITS GREAT! Go back to moparscape

Heres some links to educate yourself since I am sure you have no idea what I am talking about:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1953_Iranian_coup_d’%C3%A9tat
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_support_for_Iraq_during_the_Iran–Iraq_war

I agree that your foreign policy is a piece of shit, and I salute you for admitting that. But imo this particular case justifies action.[/quote]

I see North Korea as a threat but I don’t see why the United States needs to become involved with this more than they have too, the Japanese already have their own AEGIS based missile defense systems and they were already more than prepared to take action after the failed 2009 missile tests and I am sure the surrounding countries have a variety of other missile defense systems (supplies by the US). I think its fine that we supply our allies with these systems (as long as they are paying for them) and I think it would be appropriate for any of these countries to shot down a rocket fired by North Korea if it begins to get close enough that a nuclear payload would effect that country. I don’t see how North Korea would be dumb enough to try anything considering they are a pimple on the ass of the earth and the United States and its allies have more than enough weapon systems to level their country if they ever declared war or tried to attack us. The US should take action if the missile is headed on a trajectory that specifically targets us, otherwise other countries are than equipped and ready to take care of this if it targets them. It seems like every time the US gets asked to help out in something like this we end up taking the blame when all is fucked. IE Brits ask US to help them overthrow Mosaddegh and now 60 years later Europe blames us for everything happening in the middle east when they were involved in the same exact shit

Read full topic

item.title: Pentagon activates global missile defense during NK's missile launch
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

They’ve been starving for years, and you’re assuming the food actually makes it to those people.

Whilst I don’t like the idea of civilians dying of starvation if its required to start a revolution it might be the only way. I doubt very much the people were told it came from America if they did receive it, and thus their faith in their dictators is restored IF they did receive a bucket load of food (as obviously they will take credit for it). Arguably doing more harm than good by strengthening the leaders pull over the people further.

item.title: Pentagon activates global missile defense during NK's missile launch
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

t4:

so they test fired missiles that are heading towards Australia? or what?

It’s meant to land just before Australia. The problem is, we have no idea what the payload of this is. So America has positioned itself to shoot it down. As has Japan. North Korea claims it’s just a satellite but chances are, it’s a long-ranged test. North Korea signed an agreement not to test these. American food supplies to the North Korean people have now been stopped.

The Pentagon recently activated its global missile shield in anticipation of North Korea’s launch of a long-range missile, according to defense officials.

The measures include stepped-up electronic monitoring, deployment of missile interceptor ships, and activation of radar networks to areas near the Korean peninsula and western Pacific.

The Obama administration will regard any launch by North Korea as a violation of U.N. Security Council resolutions regardless of whether the North Koreans claim the rocket test is for space launch purposes, the officials said. The technology and rocketry used for a space launch is nearly identical to that used with ballistic missiles that carry a warhead, they said.

Also, because the payload or warhead of the test launch cannot be determined prior to launch, the Obama administration decided to activate the missile defense system.

According to U.S. officials, current intelligence assessments indicate the North Korean missile will be launched from a base called Tongchang-ri, located on a west coast peninsula north of Pyongyang between April 12 and April 15.
